intro: Gyrotaenia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited gyrotaenia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a small, smooth, yellow drupe that matures in late summer. Gyrotaenia microcarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
